Modification_Detail.description: Original context file for the 35-m ESA antenna at Malarguee when used for JPL-based radio science activities. DSS-84 is an ad hoc identifier assigned by the JPL Radar and Radio Science Systems Group.

Internal_Reference.comment: The Software Interface Specification (SIS) for the Radio Science Receiver (RSR) principles of operation and output data format description. A portable RSR could be temporarily installed at the Malarguee ESA tracking station to collect open loop radio science data.

External_Reference.description: An overview of the Malarguee station of the European Space Agency tracking network.

Telescope.description: DSS-84 is an ad hoc identifier for the ESA 35-m telescope near Malarguee, Argentina, assigned by the Radar and Radio Science Systems Group at JPL. The telescope is a Cassegrain beam waveguide (BWG) antenna constructed between 2009 and 2012; it was inaugurated in December 2012 and began routine service in early 2013. The telescope has dichroic mirrors to separate X- and Ka-band signals; it transmits up to 20 kW at 7 GHz and receives at 8 GHz 32 GHz using helium-cooled low-noise amplifiers. The ESA designation for the telescope is DSA-3, following New Norcia (DSA-1; DSS-74) and Cebreros (DSA-2).
